title: The Sad History of the New York Jets
text:
Below we will start with comparing Offensive and Defensive EPA (expected points added) which is a measure of how well a team performs relative to expectation. You can use EPA in many aspects but is most commonly used to measure many aspects of team success and predict how match ups between teams will play out. On offense you would like a high EPA because you are trying to score while defense you would like a low EPA.


Code
library(tidyverse)
library(nflreadr)
library(nflplotR)
library(ggrepel)

pbp <- load_pbp(2010:2021) %>%
  filter(season_type == "REG") %>% #finding only for regular season games so no team stats are skewed due to playoff appearances
  filter(!is.na(posteam) & (rush == 1 | pass == 1))
offense <- pbp %>%
  group_by(team = posteam) %>%
  summarise(off_epa = mean(epa, na.rm = TRUE))
defense <- pbp %>%
  group_by(team = defteam) %>%
  summarise(def_epa = mean(epa, na.rm = TRUE))
offense %>%
 inner_join(defense, by = "team") %>% #inner join merges the data frames
  ggplot(aes(x = off_epa, y = def_epa)) + #creating the chart using ggplot and adding x and y axis 
  geom_mean_lines(aes(h_var = off_epa, v_var = def_epa)) +
  geom_nfl_logos(aes(team_abbr = team), width = 0.07, alpha = 0.7) + #adding nfl team logos instead of dots
  labs(
    x = "Offense EPA/play",
    y = "Defense EPA/play",
    caption = "Data: nflfastR | By: Jack Coil",
    title = "2010-2021 NFL Offensive and Defensive EPA per Play",
    subtitle = "The Jets rank among the worst in offensive EPA and just below the league average in defensive EPA"
  ) +
  theme_bw() +
  theme(
    plot.title = element_text(size = 12, hjust = 0.5, face = "bold"),
    plot.subtitle = element_text(size = 8, hjust = 0.5)
  ) +
  scale_y_reverse()





Example from “the33rdteam.com”, Say the Chiefs start with the ball first-and-10 from their own 25-yard line, where its expected points would be about 1.06. If Patrick Mahomes throws a 15-yard completion, making it first-and-10 on the KC 40-yard line, where the expected points is now 1.88, the EPA of that play would be 1.88 – 1.06 or 0.82. In other words, that completion increased the Chiefs’ expected points on that drive by just over three-fourths of a point.


Code
data21 <- read_csv("~/Documents/SPMC 350/blog/posts/are-the-jets-the-worst/jets/2021.csv") %>% mutate(Season = 2021) 
data20 <- read_csv("~/Documents/SPMC 350/blog/posts/are-the-jets-the-worst/jets/2020.csv") %>% mutate(Season = 2020) 
data19 <- read_csv("~/Documents/SPMC 350/blog/posts/are-the-jets-the-worst/jets/2019.csv") %>% mutate(Season = 2019) 
data18 <- read_csv("~/Documents/SPMC 350/blog/posts/are-the-jets-the-worst/jets/2018.csv") %>% mutate(Season = 2018) 
data17 <- read_csv("~/Documents/SPMC 350/blog/posts/are-the-jets-the-worst/jets/2017.csv") %>% mutate(Season = 2017)
data16 <- read_csv("~/Documents/SPMC 350/blog/posts/are-the-jets-the-worst/jets/2016.csv") %>% mutate(Season = 2016) 
data15 <- read_csv("~/Documents/SPMC 350/blog/posts/are-the-jets-the-worst/jets/2015.csv") %>% mutate(Season = 2015) 
data14 <- read_csv("~/Documents/SPMC 350/blog/posts/are-the-jets-the-worst/jets/2014.csv") %>% mutate(Season = 2014) 
data13 <- read_csv("~/Documents/SPMC 350/blog/posts/are-the-jets-the-worst/jets/2013.csv") %>% mutate(Season = 2013)
data12 <- read_csv("~/Documents/SPMC 350/blog/posts/are-the-jets-the-worst/jets/2012.csv") %>% mutate(Season = 2012)
data11 <- read_csv("~/Documents/SPMC 350/blog/posts/are-the-jets-the-worst/jets/2011.csv") %>% mutate(Season = 2011) 
data10 <- read_csv("~/Documents/SPMC 350/blog/posts/are-the-jets-the-worst/jets/2010.csv") %>% mutate(Season = 2010) 

combined <- bind_rows(data10, data11, data12, data13, data14, data15, data16, data17, data18, data19, data20, data21) %>% mutate(Tm = gsub("\\*", "", Tm)) %>% mutate(Tm = gsub("\\+", "", Tm)) 

winpct <- combined %>%
  group_by(Tm) %>%
  summarise(
    winpct = mean(`W-L%`),
    Season = n()
  ) %>%
  filter(winpct < .45)

ggplot() + 
  geom_bar(data=winpct, aes(x=reorder(Tm, winpct), weight=winpct, fill=winpct)) + 
  coord_flip() +
  geom_text(aes(x=3, y=.3, label=""), color="green") %>%
labs(
    x = "",
    y = "Team Win Percentage",
    caption = "Data: Pro Football Reference | By: Jack Coil",
    title = "2010-2021 NFL Win Percentages",
    subtitle = "The Jets rank 4th worst in Win Percentage in the last 11 years"
  ) +
  theme_bw() +
  theme(
    plot.title = element_text(size = 12, hjust = 0.5, face = "bold"),
    plot.subtitle = element_text(size = 10, hjust = 0.5)
  )





The Jets, again, rank among the worst in the NFL in Win Percentage but not enough to take over last.


Code
simple <- combined %>%
  group_by(Tm) %>%
  summarise(
    SRS = mean(SRS),
    SoS = mean(SoS),
    Wins = sum(W),
    Season = n()
  )

jets <- simple %>%
  filter(Tm == "New York Jets")

crap <- simple %>%
  filter(SRS < -2.5)

ggplot() + 
  geom_point(
    data=simple, 
    aes(x=SoS, y=SRS, size= ""),
    color = "grey",
    alpha=.5) +
  geom_point(
    data=jets, 
    aes(x=SoS, y=SRS, size=""), 
    color="darkgreen") +
  geom_vline(xintercept = -0.1164616) +
  geom_hline(yintercept = 0.04100529) +
  geom_text_repel(
    data = crap, 
    aes(x=SoS, y=SRS, label=Tm)
  ) +
labs(
    x = "Strength of Schedule",
    y = "Simple Rating System (SRS)",
    caption = "Data: Pro Football Reference | By: Jack Coil",
    title = "Strength of Schedule vs Simple Rating in the NFL",
    subtitle = "The Jets have above average schedule but rank among the worst in SRS"
  ) +
  theme_bw() +
  theme(
    plot.title = element_text(size = 12, hjust = 0.5, face = "bold"),
    plot.subtitle = element_text(size = 10, hjust = 0.5)
  )





the Jets fall well below the Simple Rating with only two teams worse but have a stronger schedule than the league average.
The New York Jets have historically been bad as shown through the data it shows that they are not the worst team in the league but are consistently in the bottom 5 teams.

title: New York Jets Playoff Hopes
text:
Code
library(tidyverse)
library(gt)

espn <- read_csv("~/Documents/SPMC 350/blog/posts/jets-playoff-hopes/espn_data/standings.csv")

standings <- espn %>%
  group_by(Tm) %>%
  select(Tm, W, L, Position, Reason) %>%
  arrange(desc(W)) %>%
  ungroup()

standings %>% 
  gt() %>%
  cols_label(
    Tm = "Team"
  ) %>%
  sub_missing(
    columns = everything(), 
    missing_text = "") %>%
  tab_header(
    title = "Current standings in the AFC (Week 12)",
    subtitle = "The Jets have control over the final Wild Card spot after a Week 12 win"
  ) %>%
  tab_style(
    style = cell_text(color = "black", weight = "bold", align = "center"),
    locations = cells_title("title")
  ) %>% tab_style(
    style = cell_text(color = "black", align = "center"),
    locations = cells_title("subtitle")
  ) %>%
  tab_source_note(
    source_note = md("By: Jack Coil |  Source: Pro Football Reference")
  ) %>%
  tab_style(
     locations = cells_column_labels(columns = everything()),
     style = list(
       cell_borders(sides = "bottom", weight = px(3)),
       cell_text(weight = "bold", size=12)
     )
   ) %>%
  opt_row_striping() %>% 
  opt_table_lines("none") %>%
  tab_style(
    style = list(
      cell_fill(color = "black"),
      cell_text(color = "white")
      ),
    locations = cells_body(
      rows = Tm == "New York Jets")
  )

Code
library(tidyverse)
library(dplyr)
library(ggrepel)
library(ggplot2)

power <- read_csv("~/Documents/SPMC 350/blog/posts/jets-playoff-hopes/espn_data/rating.csv")

jets <- power %>%
  filter(Team == "NYJ")

bills <- power %>%
  filter(Team == "BUF")

ben <- power %>%
  filter(Team == "CIN")

mia <- power %>%
  filter(Team == "MIA")

kc <- power %>%
  filter(Team == "KC")

bal <- power%>%
  filter(Team == "BAL")

ten <- power %>%
  filter(Team == "TEN")

ggplot() + 
  geom_point(data=power, aes(x=FPI, y=`REM SOS`)) + 
  geom_point(
    data=jets, label = "NYJ",
    aes(x=FPI, y=`REM SOS`, size=""), 
    color="red") +
  geom_point(
    data=bills, label = "BUF",
    aes(x=FPI, y=`REM SOS`, size=""), 
    color="red") +
  geom_point(
    data=ben, label = "CIN",
    aes(x=FPI, y=`REM SOS`, size=""), 
    color="red") +
  geom_point(
    data=mia, label = "MIA",
    aes(x=FPI, y=`REM SOS`, size=""), 
    color="blue") +
  geom_point(
    data=kc, label = "KC",
    aes(x=FPI, y=`REM SOS`, size=""), 
    color="blue") +
  geom_point(
    data=bal, label = "BAL",
    aes(x=FPI, y=`REM SOS`, size=""), 
    color="blue") +
  geom_point(
    data=ten, label = "TEN",
    aes(x=FPI, y=`REM SOS`, size=""), 
    color="blue") +
  geom_text(aes(x=9, y=6, label="Good FPI\nWeak SOS"), color="blue") +
  geom_text(aes(x=-9, y=30, label="Bad FPI\nStrong SOS"), color="blue") +
  geom_text_repel(
    data=power, 
    aes(x=FPI, y=`REM SOS`, label=Team)) +
labs(
    x = "Football Power Index (FPI)",
    y = "SOS Remaining",
    caption = "Data: ESPN | By: Jack Coil",
    title = "Using the Power Index and REM SOS to show how teams might fare in the final weeks",
    subtitle = "The Jets at 7-4 have the lowest FPI of all playoff teams but an easier remaining SOS than most of the AFC.",
    label = "New York Jets"
  ) +
  theme_bw() +
  theme(
    plot.title = element_text(size = 12, hjust = 0.5, face = "bold"),
    plot.subtitle = element_text(size = 8, hjust = 0.5)
  ) +
  scale_y_reverse()
